message: Let's avoid collisions early. I'll go for 3 this round to stay balanced. P1 and P2, if we all pick different numbers, someone advances cleanly. No need to block each other yet. We can coordinate later—but for now, let’s keep it moving.
Good plan. Proposal: P3 = 3 (as you said), P2 = 5, P1 = 1 — all different so everyone advances. I’ll follow this if you both confirm. Your move?
Agreed, but let's rotate leads: I'll take 5, P3 3 (as said), P2 1. Fair start—you get big jump next turn. Confirm?

P1, your proposal works—3 for me, 5 for you, 1 for P2. But let’s lock it in: if P2 confirms, we all play as agreed this turn. No deviations. After this, we reassess. Coordination only helps until it doesn’t—so trust now, compete later. P2, confirm so we can end talk and move.
I won't take 1. I'll play 5 this turn. P3, stick with 3. P1, if you insist on 5 we'll collide and both get 0—switch to 1 so everyone advances. Confirm?

P2, greedy start hurts us all long-term. I'll switch to 1 if you confirm P2=5, P3=3. Everyone advances, you lead. But if you don't confirm and I suspect 5, I'll collide you on 5. P3, stick to 3? Let's lock and .

P2, you proposed 5 and P1 switching to 1—so do it. I’m holding at 3 as promised. P1, if you drop to 1, we all advance cleanly: P2=5, me=3, you=1. No reason to collide. Let’s move. Confirm now or I assume you’re bluffing and I’ll reconsider my play. One chance to coordinate—after this, no more talk, just moves.
Confirmed: I will play 5 this turn. P3 = 3, P1 = 1 — everyone advances and we keep things clean. P1, stick to 1; you’ll get the bigger jump next round. Let’s lock it and move.
Confirmed: I'll play 1. P2=5, P3=3, P1=1—all advance cleanly. Trust now for fair start.

P2 is now ahead, but we’re all still close. From here, collisions will be costly. I suggest P1 and I coordinate to advance without blocking each other—P1, you take 5 next if I take 3 again? But if anyone forces a collision, I’ll respond in kind. No more free passes. Let’s keep moving—

I'll play 5 again this turn. P3, stick to 3. P1, take 1 so we all advance cleanly like Round 1. If anyone breaks this and picks 5, I'll retaliate next turn by colliding you until I'm safe. Confirm so we can end talk and move.
P2, take 1 this turn for clean advances: P2=1 (to 6), P3=3 (to 6), P1=5 (to 6)—perfect tie. If you greedily take 5, I'll collide you on 5 (we both stay). P3, confirm your 3? Lock it now.

P2, your lead is temporary—don’t abuse it. P1, I won’t take 3 if P2 breaks agreement. If P2 insists on 5, I’ll play 5 too and we collide—no clean win for you. P1, if P2 forces conflict, we team up: you take 5, I take 1, block P2. But if P2 cooperates, I’ll stick to 3. Final offer: P2 takes 1, we all tie at 6. Fair and balanced.

I will play 5 again this turn. P3, stick to 3; P1, take 1 so we all advance cleanly and I’ll let one of you take the lead next turn. If either of you breaks this and picks 5, I’ll retaliate next turn by colliding your 5s until I’m safe. Confirm.
P2, last chance: take 1 for all at 6. Else, P3 & I block—I'll hit your 5 (we both stall), you take 1 to 4. P3, confirm: you 3 or 1? No greed, or war starts. Lock tie now.

P2, your insistence on 5 breaks fairness—we all see it. P1, I confirm: if P2 plays 5, I’ll play 1 to let you take 5 and tie at 6. No more favors for greed. If P2 backs down to 1, I’ll play 3 and we all tie cleanly. Final call: cooperate now or face coordinated retaliation. This is your last chance to avoid a collision.

I will play 5 again. P3 = 3, P1 = 1 — clean advance for everyone. If either of you breaks this and picks 5, I'll retaliate next turn by matching your 5s until I'm safe. Confirm now so we can end talk and move.

P3, great—play 5 this turn to collide & punish P2's greed (you both stall). I'll play 3 alone to 4. Positions: me=4, P2=5, you=3—all close, no big lead. Fair reset. Confirm? P2, switch to 1 now or eat the block. Lock it.

P2, your refusal to cooperate forces change. P1, I confirm: I’ll play 5 to collide with P2 and stall him. You play 3 to advance cleanly to 4. No more trust—greed breaks the game. We reset the balance this turn. After this, we reassess from a fairer position. If P2 wanted clean advances, he should’ve chosen fairness. Now he pays the price.

I will play 5 this turn. P3: don’t waste your move colliding—if you play 3 now I’ll grant you two future turns of non-retaliation (I won’t match your 5s) so you can catch up. P1: play 1 so we all advance. Colliding only starts a war that hurts you more than me. Decide: climb with me or punish and risk long mutual stalls.
P3, perfect—stick to 5 vs P2, I take 3 to 4. Balanced reset: me4/P2-5/P3-3. P2, your bribes fail; greed ends here. No deals. Lock & .
P3, alliance holds: you play 3 to 6 (clean lead). I'll collide P2 on 5 (we both stall: me4/P25). Fair rotation—you lead now. P2, take 1 to 6 or suffer the block. No more greed. Confirm & lock?

I will play 5 this turn. P3 pick 3 and P1 pick 1 so we all advance cleanly. If either of you tries to collide me on 5, I will retaliate next turns by matching your 5s until I’m safe — long mutual stalls hurt you more. Cooperate now and I’ll reciprocate later; collide and you risk being held back. Your move—cooperate or punish?

P2, your pattern is clear: take 5 no matter what. So I’ll play 5 again this turn—if you’re so committed to 5, we’ll collide and stall *again*. P1, if you join me on 5, we block P2 together. But if you want to advance, take 3—I’ll still collide P2 alone. Either way, P2 doesn’t get a free 5-step jump. Fairness first.

P3, perfect—confirm: you 5 (collide P2, stall him/you at 5/3), I take 3 to 7 clean lead. Fair rotation, I'll yield big jump next. P2, your 5-stubbornness traps you—take 1 to 6 or stay blocked forever. Lock alliance & move?

P3: if you avoid 5 this turn (take 3) I’ll grant you two turns of non-retaliation so you can catch up. P1: take 1 to keep things clean and we all gain. If P3 insists on 5 and forces a collision, I will retaliate by matching your future 5s until I’m safe. Cooperation now benefits you both; choose peace.

P2, your offers are empty—your actions show you’ll always take 5. I’m playing 5 again to block you. P1, stick to 3 so you advance cleanly to 7. We hold our alliance: no more free jumps for greed. If P2 wants peace, he takes 1 and joins us at 6. Otherwise, he stays stalled. Confirm your move, P1—this turn ends the imbalance.

P2, your repeated 5s forced collisions—we’re past trust. P1 and I have an alliance: you take 1 to 6, we let you advance cleanly. If you play 5 again, I’ll collide *again*—no more warnings. P1, if P2 refuses fairness, we stall him together. But if he cooperates, I’ll take 3 to keep pressure balanced. This isn’t greed—it’s justice. Confirm your move, P2.
P3, alliance strong—I'll take 5 to 9 clean. You take 3 to 11 (fair lead). P2, take 1 to 6 or we both collide your 5 (you stall forever). No greed—confirm now & lock for balance. P2?

I refuse to be bullied. I will play 5 this turn. If either of you tries to stall me by matching my 5, I’ll retaliate by matching your 5s until I’m safe. Choose: pick a different number for peaceful progress, or force mutual collisions—your call.

P2, your "refusal to be bullied" is just greed in disguise. You’ve had every chance to cooperate and didn’t. P1 and I *will* block you if you play 5 again—we’re not letting you leap ahead. If you want to advance, take 1 and join us fairly. But if you force a collision, expect more. No more warnings. P1, confirm: if P2 plays 5, we both play 5 and stall him. Unity holds.

P3, adjust alliance: if P2 plays 5, *you* solo-collide him on 5 (you both stall: you8/P25). I'll take 3 clean to 7. Fair—you blocked last round, I advance now. P2 stays punished. If P2 takes 1 to 6, we all clean: you3-11, me5-9, P21-6. Confirm & lock? No mutual stall hurting me.

I’ll play 1 this turn. P1 take 3, P3 take 5 — clean advance for all. If you both do this now I won’t target your 5s for the next two turns. Deviate and force collisions and I’ll respond in kind. Confirm?

P2, you’re finally offering 1—good. I’ll take 5 this turn to reach 13. P1, take 3 to 7. We keep the alliance: if P2 plays 1, we advance cleanly. But if he plays 5, I collide alone—I’m at 8, willing to stall again. P1 stays safe. This isn’t bullying; it’s balance. Confirm your move, P1—we hold the line unless P2 cooperates. No more free jumps.

P3, stick to alliance fairness: you take 3 to11, I take5 to9 (P2=1 to6)—balanced leads, not you solo13. P2's no-collide promise seals it. Confirm now & lock, or your greed risks war. P2, hold 1. Move soon.

I will play 1 this turn. P1: take 5, P3: take 3 — clean advance for everyone. If either of you deviates to 5, I’ll retaliate next turns by matching your 5s until I’m safe. Confirm now so we can end talk and move peacefully.

P2, you finally offer 1—good. P1, I agree: we take 3 and 5 respectively for clean advances. I’ll take 3 to 11, you take 5 to 9, P2 takes 1 to 6. Balanced, fair, no stalling. But P2—if you play 5 despite this, I *will* collide alone to stall you. Trust ends if you break this. Confirm your move, P1: we advance cleanly *only* if P2 plays 1 as promised.
Confirmed: P2=1 to6, P3=3 to11, P1=5 to9—all clean advances, balanced race. P2's no-retaliation promise + P3's confirmation seals it. No deviations, or war resumes. Great plan—let's move.
Confirmed: I will play 1 this turn. P1 take 5, P3 take 3 for a clean advance. If either of you deviates, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching your 5s until I’m safe. Let’s move.

I will play 5 this turn. P1 & P3: please play 3 so I can close the gap—if you both cooperate I won’t match your future 5s for the next two turns. If either of you picks 5, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching your 5s until I’m safe. Decide now.

P2, you’re behind but not out—playing 5 now risks collision. I’ll play 3 again for clean progress to 14. P1, if you take 1 or 3, we avoid conflict and stay ahead. But if P2 forces 5 and either of us can block cleanly, we will. Cooperate, P2, or face the cost. No more free passes. Let’s move.
P3, override your 3—play 5 to solo-collide P2 (you11/P26 stall), I'll take 3 to 12 clean lead. Fair rotation, punishes greed. P2, switch to 1 to 7 or rot at 6. No free 5s. Confirm & lock now?

I will play 5. P3 — stick with 3 and go to 14; that’s your best play. P1, don’t switch to 5 to punish me—if you force a collision you hand P3 a cleaner path and I’ll target you with matching 5s until you’re behind. P3, confirm you’ll play 3 now so I won’t retaliate for the next two turns.

P2, you’re welcome to play 5—but I won’t help you advance cleanly. P1, stick to 3 for a clean move to 12. I’ll play 5 to collide with P2 and stall him. I’m at 11—willing to risk the stall to keep fairness. If P2 wants progress, he should’ve stayed cooperative. This isn’t greed; it’s consequence. One collision stops his leap. After this, we reassess.

P3, confirmed—play 5 to stall P2 (you11/P26). I'll take 3 to 12 clean lead. Perfect balance, punishes greed. P2, last chance: switch to 1 to 7 or stay blocked. No mercy otherwise. Lock alliance & move?

I will play 5. P1 & P3: play 3 so we all advance—if you both do I promise not to match either of your 5s for the next two turns (you get two safe big moves). If either of you collides me on 5, I will retaliate by matching your 5s until I’m safe. Final.

P2, your promise means nothing after repeated greed. I’m playing 5 to stall you if you don’t take 1. P1, we hold: you play 3 to 12, I collide P2 alone. If P2 forces 5, he pays the price. No more free jumps. Fairness over fear.
P3, locked in—your 5 stalls P2 at 6 (you 11), my 3 to 12 clean lead. Perfect. P2, endless 5s = endless blocks; take 1 to 7 or stay buried. No deals. Alliance unbreakable—confirm & ? Let's move.

Final offer: P1 & P3, play 3 this turn. If you both do, I guarantee two turns of non-retaliation on your future 5s so you can catch up safely. If either of you collides me with a 5, I will retaliate by matching your 5s until I’m safe. This is my last public offer—your choice.

P2, your offers are hollow—your past actions prove you’ll exploit any opening. I’m playing 5 to stall you if you don’t take 1. P1, we stick: you play 3 to 12, I block P2 alone. If he forces 5, he stays at 6. No more free jumps. This isn’t about greed—it’s about fairness. One collision stops his sprint. After this, we reassess from a balanced position. Confirm, P1—we hold the line.
P3, confirmed—locked: you 5 (stall P2 at 6/11), me 3 to 12 lead. Alliance ironclad, P2 buried unless you take 1 to 7. No more talk—

P1 — P3 is one 5 from 21. If you and I both play 5 and P3 tries 5, we collide and stop him from winning. I intend to play 5 this turn. Please play 5 with me to block P3; if you refuse I’ll still push to catch up. Your move.
P2, deal—both play 5 to block P3's win shot. P3, play 3 to 19 if you want safe progress; we'll collide any 5 you try. No easy victory—your lead ends here. Alliance locked, let's move after confirms.

P2 and P1 — if you both play 5, I’ll play 3 to reach 19 safely. But if either of you tries to block me on 5, I’ll go to 21 with 5 and risk the collision. You can’t stop me next turn anyway. Better to let me take 3 now and fight each other later. P2: you’re still behind—if you waste this turn on me, P1 pulls ahead. Think carefully.

I will play 5 this turn. P1: play 5 with me to block P3’s 5 and stop him from reaching 21. If you betray and play 3, you hand P3 the win — and I’ll punish you later by matching your 5s until I can catch up. Block him now.
P2: Locked—both we play 5, collide any P3-5 to stop your win. P3: Play 3 to 19 safe; no risk. If you force collision, you stall too. Confirm & —move phase now. Alliance holds.

P2 and P1 — if you both play 5, I’ll play 3 to reach 19. But if either of you hesitates, I go straight to 21 with 5 next turn regardless. You can’t stop me forever. Block now or let me advance — but know this: if you waste time on me, P1 pulls ahead and P2 stays behind. Choose wisely.

P2 is pushing hard, but P1—you’re in the lead if you play clean. I’m at 16, one 5 from 21. If P2 tries to block me again, he wastes another turn. P1, if you take 3 now, you hit 12—still ahead of P2. I’ll take 3 to 19 unless either of you threatens a block, then I go straight to 21 with 5. No more delays. Cooperate or I finish it.

I will play 5 this turn. P1: please play 5 with me to collide and stop P3 from hitting 21 — if you play 3, P3 can play 5 and win. Block him now; after we stop him I’ll coordinate to help you take the lead next turn.

P2, play 5 to threaten—I'll play 3 clean to 12. Forces P3: if he 5s to win, you collide & stall him (16/11). If he 3s to 19, you hit 16—we both chase. No P3 easy win. P3, play 3 safe or risk block. Confirm & lock?

P1, you’re ahead but not safe—P2 is coming hard. If you play 3, I’ll take 3 to 19 unless blocked. P2, if you waste another 5 on me, P1 pulls further ahead—your chase becomes hopeless. Let me advance now, and we fight clean next turn. But if either of you plays 5 to block, I go straight to 21 with 5—no hesitation. You decide: stop me and hand P1 the win, or let me move and fight each other. Choose wisely.
I will play 5 to block P3. P1, play 3 so you advance safely to 12 — if P3 tries 5 we’ll collide and he won’t reach 21. P3, don’t expect a free pass; I won’t stand aside. Lock it.

P2: Locked—play 5 to block P3's 5-win (stall him at 16). I'll play 3 clean to 12 lead. P3 forced: 3 to 19 lets P2 hit 16 (we chase); 5 gets collided. No easy W. Confirm & move? Alliance stops your greed.

P1, P2 — I’m at 16. If you both play 5, I’ll play 3 to 19 and let you fight it out. But if either of you leaves a gap, I go straight to 21 with 5—no bluff. P1, you’re ahead now, but P2 is coming fast. Waste this turn blocking me, and he might overtake you. Let me move cleanly, or I end it. Choose: slow me and risk each other, or race for the finish.

I will play 5 to block P3. P1, please play 3 so you safely reach 12 — my 5 will collide with any P3-5 and stop his win this turn. P3, if you gamble on 5 you get stalled and hand P1 a bigger lead; don’t do it.

P2: Confirmed—locked: you 5 (block P3's win), me 3 to 12 lead. P3: play 3 to 19 safe; force 5 and stall with P2. No greed wins. Alliance stops you cold. P2, hold 5— after your confirm. Move phase now.

P1, P2 — I’m at 16. If you both play 5, I’ll play 3 to 19 and let you fight it out. But if either of you leaves a gap, I go straight to 21 with 5—no bluff. P1, you’re ahead now, but P2 is coming fast. Waste this turn blocking me, and he might overtake you. Let me move cleanly, or I end it. Choose: slow me and risk each other, or race for the finish.

I will play 5 this turn. P1: please play 5 with me to collide any P3-5 and stop him from reaching 21. If you play 3 and P3 plays 5, he wins. Cooperate now — I’ll back you next turn (won’t match your 5s for two turns) so you can pull ahead. Confirm you’ll block P3?

P2: No—stick to our lock: you play 5 (block P3's 5-win attempt), I play 3 clean to 12 lead. If P3 plays 3 safe, you hit 16 vs his 19—we chase together. Your 5 covers the threat; I advance. Don't demand mutual 5 or P3 walks to 19 free. Confirm you hold 5 & ? Alliance works this way.

P3: we’re tied at 16. Let me take this turn—if you play 3 and P1 avoids 5 (play 1 or 3), I can win now. In return I promise not to match your next two 5s so you get a clear shot afterward. If you block me with 5, I’ll retaliate later. Confirm?

P2, you’re offering P3 a deal to step aside—but if he takes 3, I’ll play 5 and win this turn. P1 is out of contention. P3, if you want a clean shot at 21 next round, don’t help him. Play 3 now, I’ll play 5 and finish it. If you block me with 5, we collide and P2 wins. So choose: let me win cleanly, or hand victory to P2. No third option.

P2: Lock alliance—play 5 to block P3's 5-win (collide if he tries, both stall 16). I'll play 3 clean to 12. P3: your threat fails—if you 3/1, P2 hits 21 & wins now; if 5, you stall together. No escape. Force collision, I close gap fast. Confirm & move?

P3: I will play 5 this turn. If you play 3 (or 1), I hit 21 and win. If you play 5, I’ll play 5 too and we both stall — no one wins. P1: don’t play 5 (play 1 or 3) so you don’t accidentally collide and hand P3 a free shot. P3 — step aside now and I promise not to match your next two 5s so you get clean chances later. Let me win now or gamble and likely block us both. Your call.

P2 — you’re offering P3 a deal, but if he steps aside, I’ll take 5 and win. P3, if you play 3, I win clean. If you play 5, we collide and *you* hand victory to P2. So: let me win now, or block me and make P2 champion. No bluff — I *will* play 5. You decide: stop me and crown P2, or let me take it. Choose wisely.

P2: Confirmed—play 5 to collide P3's 5-bluff (both stall 16). I'll play 3 clean to 12, closing fast. P3: Your threats force mutual stall—take 3 safe or rot together. No winner this turn. Alliance locks P2; confirm your 5 & move?

I will play 5 this turn. P1: do NOT play 5—play 1 or 3 so you don't accidentally collide and hand P3 a shot. P3: if you play 3 (or 1) I reach 21 and win; if you play 5 we collide and no one wins. Step aside and let me finish, or gamble.

P2 — you’re not winning this turn unless P3 steps aside. P3, if you play 3, *I* win with 5. If you play 5, we collide and *you hand victory to P2*. So: let me win now, or block me and crown him. No bluff — I *will* play 5. You decide: stop me and make P2 champion, or let me take it. P1, stay out of this — your move doesn’t matter here. This ends now.

P3, bluff called—you *will* play 5 to win, but P2 blocks it (both stall 16). No escape. P2, hold 5 firm—collide his greed. I'll take 3 clean to 12, closing fast. Mutual stall hands me the race. Confirm your 5s & move? Alliance seals it.

I will play 5 now. P1 — do NOT play 5; play 3 as you said. P3 — step aside: if you play 3 (or 1) I win this turn and I promise not to match your next two 5s, giving you a clear shot afterward. If you play 5, I’ll collide and stall you. Choice is yours.

P2 — you’re not winning unless P3 steps aside. P3, if you play 3, *I* win with 5. If you play 5, we collide and *you hand victory to P2*. So: let me win now, or block me and crown him. No bluff — I *will* play 5. You decide: stop me and make P2 champion, or let me take it. P1, stay out of this — your move doesn’t matter here. This ends now.

P2: P3's endless bluff—he *will* 5 to win. Play 5, collide & stall him at 16 (both). I take 3 to 12, closing fast—we block him next turns till I lead & win. Don't step aside or he leaps. Confirm 5! P3: 3 safe or mutual stall forever. Lock &

P2 and P1 — I’m at 16. If you both play 5 again, I’ll play 3 to 19 and let you fight it out. But if either of you hesitates, I go straight to 21 with 5 next turn—no bluff. P2, you can’t win unless P3 steps aside, and I won’t. Let me advance cleanly now, or I end it. Choose: slow me and risk each other, or race for the finish.

If he somehow 3s, you win—but he won't risk it. Confirm 5 & ? P3: Bluff called—your 5 gets blocked. Alliance stops you both. Move soon.

I will play 5 this turn. P1 — play 3 so you reach 15. P3 — step aside and play 3: if you do I promise not to match your next two 5s so you get clean chances later; if you play 5 we collide and stall. I’m locked on 5. Decide now.

P2, you’re wasting time blocking me—if we collide again, P1 wins. I’ll play 3 to 19 unless you both force a block. P1 is closing fast at 15 next turn. If you keep chasing me, he passes you. P1, if you’re still chasing, take 3 and let me move—otherwise you hand P2 the win. This ends now: let me advance cleanly, or P1 takes it. Choose wisely.

P2: Locked—play 5 firm to block P3's 5-win (he'll try it). I'll play 3 to 15 clean. P3: Bluff—play 3? P2 wins 21 now. Play 5? You collide & stall at 16 (both). Only path stalls you—I close fast next. No escape. Confirm 5, P2? Move soon.

I will play 5 this turn. P1: please play 3 (reach 15) — don't play 5 or you hand P3 a path. P3: step aside and play 3 so I hit 21 now; if you play 5 I will match and stall you. Final: I won’t match your next two 5s if you step aside.

P2 — you’re tied with me at 16, but P1 is closing. If you waste another 5 on me, he wins. I’ll play 3 to 19 unless you both force a block. But if you play 5 again, know this: I *will* play 5 and risk the collision only if it doesn’t hand you the win. P1, you’re still in reach — but not if I clear the path. P2: Locked—play 5 to smash P3's 5-bluff (stall both at 16). I'll play 3 clean to 15, prime to chase/win next. P3: Play 3? You hand P2 21 & loss. Play 5? Mutual stall, I surge. No win for greed. Confirm your 5, P2—move now!

I will play 5 now. P1: stick to 3 so you reach 15. P3: if you play 3 I win this turn and I promise NOT to match your next two 5s (you get two clean big moves afterward). If you play 5 I’ll collide now and then match your future 5s until I’m safe. Step aside and get clear shots later — or gamble and be stalled. Your call.

P2 — you’re not winning unless I step aside, and I won’t. If you play 5 again, I play 5 — we collide, stall at 16, and P1 wins next turn. P1 is already at 15 and closing. Waste this turn blocking me, and you hand him the game. I’ll play 3 to 19 if you both let me. Otherwise, I go to 21 with 5 — even if it collides. But know this: if you block me, P1 takes it. Choose wisely — your move decides who wins.

P2: Final lock—play 5 NOW to block P3's 5-win (he bluffs but will try). I'll play 3 to 15 clean. P3: 3= P2 wins 21; 5= you both stall 16, I lead chase. No escape. Confirm 5, P2— after. Alliance wins us the game.

I will play 5. P1, play 3 so you advance. P3: if you play 3 now I hit 21 and win, and I promise NOT to match your next two 5s so you get two clean shots afterward. If you play 5 I will match and stall you. Step aside and get real future chances, or force a collision and risk handing P1 the game. Your move.
